View Javadoc
1   
2   package com.github.tilastokeskus.matertis.core;
3   
4   /**
5    * Represents a game's grid. This class only holds data of stationary
6    * tetrominoes; that is, it doesn't take into account the currently falling
7    * tetromino in any way.
8    * 
9    * @author tilastokeskus
10   * @see    Tetromino
11   */
12  public class GameGrid {
13      
14      /**
15       * Represents an empty cell in the grid.
16       */
17      public static final int EMPTY = 0;
18      
19      /**
20       * Represents a wall. A wall is something that is in the game area from the
21       * beginning and tetrominoes cannot go through, and cannot be removed.
22       */
23      public static final int WALL = -1;
24      
25      /**
26       * Represents a wall that is invisible, that is, a wall that is drawn like
27       * an empty cell.
28       */
29      public static final int INVISIBLE_WALL = -2;
30      
31      protected static final int SPAWN_AREA_HEIGHT = 4;
32      
33      private final int[][] layout;
34      
35      /**
36       * Constructs a grid with the given width and height. Walls will be added
37       * around the grid, as well as an area on top of the game area.
38       * <p>
39       * The true resulting width of the grid is:
40       * <pre>  width + 2</pre>
41       * This consists of the additional left and right wall.
42       * <p>
43       * the height is:
44       * <pre>  height + 4 + 1</pre>
45       * This consists of the spawn area and the bottom wall.
46       * 
47       * @param width  width of the grid.
48       * @param height height of the grid.
49       */
50      public GameGrid(int width, int height) {
51          this.layout = new int[height + SPAWN_AREA_HEIGHT + 1][width + 2];
52          this.createWalls();
53      }
54      
55      public int getWidth() {
56          return this.layout[0].length;
57      }
58      
59      public int getHeight() {
60          return this.layout.length;
61      }
62      
63      /**
64       * Returns the data in a cell of the grid.
65       * 
66       * @param x x-coordinate of the cell.
67       * @param y y-coordinate of the cell.
68       * @return  the cell's data. Zero means empty cell, non-zero cells indicate
69       *          some hexadecimal color.
70       */
71      public int get(int x, int y) {
72          return layout[y][x];
73      }
74      
75      /**
76       * Tells whether a tetromino is in collision with a non-empty cell in the
77       * provided matrix. An empty cell should be represented by zero (0).
78       * <p>
79       * The matrix should be row-indiced. That is, grid[0] should return the
80       * first row in the matrix, and grid[3][6] should return the 7th cell of the
81       * 4th row, from top left to bottom right.
82       * 
83       * @param tetromino a tetromino object whose collision should be tested
84       *                  against the grid.
85       * @return          true if the tetromino collides with the grid, otherwise
86       *                  false.
87       * @see             Tetromino
88       */
89      public boolean tetrominoCollides(Tetromino tetromino) {
90          
91          /* iterate through the tetromino's layout */
92          for (int row = 0; row < tetromino.getLayout().length; row++) {
93              for (int col = 0; col < tetromino.getLayout()[0].length; col++) {
94                  if (tetromino.getLayout()[row][col] == EMPTY) {
95                      continue;
96                  }
97                  
98                  int x = col + tetromino.getX();
99                  int y = row + tetromino.getY();
100                 
101                 /* if the piece's location in the grid is not out of bounds, or
102                  * if in that location is a piece of some other tetromino,
103                  * return true.
104                  */
105                 if (isOutOfBounds(x, y) || layout[y][x] != EMPTY) {
106                     return true;
107                 }
108             }
109         }
110         
111         return false;
112     }
113     
114     /**
115      * Tells whether or not the provided column and row are both inside the
116      * grid's bounds.
117      * 
118      * @param col    column.
119      * @param row    row.
120      * @return       true if the position is out of bounds, otherwise false.
121      */
122     public boolean isOutOfBounds(int col, int row) {
123         return col < 0 || col >= layout[0].length ||
124                row < 0 || row >= layout.length;
125     }
126     
127     /**
128      * Adds a tetromino's layout in the grid according to the tetromino's
129      * position.
130      * <p>
131      * This method makes no checks of whether or not the tetromino collides with
132      * the grid, or if part of it is outside of the grid's bounds. If only a
133      * part of the tetromino is in the grid's bounds, the part that is in the
134      * grid's bounds will be added to the grid nonetheless.
135      * 
136      * @param tetromino a tetromino object that should be added to the grid.
137      * @see             Tetromino
138      */
139     public void setTetromino(Tetromino tetromino) {
140         
141         /* iterate through the tetromino's layout */
142         for (int row = 0; row < tetromino.getLayout().length; row++) {
143             for (int col = 0; col < tetromino.getLayout()[0].length; col++) {
144                 if (tetromino.getLayout()[row][col] == EMPTY) {
145                     continue;
146                 }
147                 
148                 int x = col + tetromino.getX();
149                 int y = row + tetromino.getY();
150                 
151                 if (!isOutOfBounds(x, y)) {
152                     int color = tetromino.colorHex;
153                     layout[y][x] = tetromino.getLayout()[row][col] * color;
154                 }
155             }
156         }
157     }
158     
159     /**
160      * Searches for filled rows from the grid, top to bottom, and on each filled
161      * row it drops all rows on top of it by one.
162      * 
163      * @return amount of filled rows found.
164      * @see    #dropRowsDownFromIndex(int)
165      * @see    #rowIsFilled(int[])
166      */
167     public int handleFilledRows() {
168         int filledRows = 0;
169         
170         for (int rowIndex = 0; rowIndex < layout.length - 1; rowIndex++) {
171             if (rowIsFilled(layout[rowIndex])) {
172                 dropRowsDownFromIndex(rowIndex);
173                 filledRows++;
174             }
175         }
176         
177         return filledRows;
178     }
179     
180     /**
181      * Removes the given row from the grid and adds an empty row on top of the
182      * grid.
183      * 
184      * @param rowIndex index of the row to remove.
185      */
186     public void dropRowsDownFromIndex(int rowIndex) {
187         for (int col = 1; col < layout[0].length - 1; col++) {
188             
189             /* iterate from rowIndex to the top of the grid */
190             for (int row = rowIndex; row > 0; row--) {
191                 
192                 /* take the value of the above cell, and set it to this cell */
193                 layout[row][col] = layout[row - 1][col];
194             }
195             
196             /* make this column's top row empty */
197             layout[0][col] = EMPTY;
198         }
199     }
200 
201     private boolean rowIsFilled(int[] row) {
202         for (int n : row) {
203             
204             /* if some element in the row is empty, return false */
205             if (n == EMPTY) {
206                 return false;
207             }
208         }
209         
210         return true;
211     }
212     
213     private void createWalls() {
214         for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++) {
215             this.layout[row][0] = INVISIBLE_WALL;
216             this.layout[row][this.getWidth() - 1] = INVISIBLE_WALL;
217         }
218         
219         for (int row = 4; row < this.getHeight(); row++) {
220             this.layout[row][0] = WALL;
221             this.layout[row][this.getWidth() - 1] = WALL;
222         }
223         
224         for (int col = 0; col < this.getWidth(); col++) {
225             this.layout[this.getHeight() - 1][col] = WALL;
226         }
227     }
228     
229 // debugging:    
230 //    public void print() {
231 //        for (int[] row : this.layout) {
232 //            System.out.println(Arrays.toString(row));
233 //        }
234 //        System.out.println();
235 //    }
236     
237 }
